fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`PDEP r32a, r32b, r/m32`
`PDEP r64a, r64b, r/m64`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: PDEP uses a mask in the second source operand (the third operand) to transfer/scatter contiguous low order bits in the first source operand (the second operand) into the destination (the first operand). PDEP takes the low bits from the first source operand and deposit them in the destination operand at the corresponding bit locations that are set in the second source operand (mask). All other bits (bits not set in mask) in destination are set to zero.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
